children.subject:
Hi! I taught WDD for the past two semesters, so this is my personal perspective. I would say that if you already have a CS/technical background, then you might find the JS part of the course too slow – we're geared toward complete beginners (including those with no coding experience). The design aspects of the course would certainly help you have more of a design mindset on whatever you're working on, though. 

Since we went remote for covid last semester, about half of our lectures are on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/wddlive/, which might help you decide whether this course will be a good fit for you.

As for the internships part of your question – the technical concepts we cover aren't enough on their own for a software engineering internship, but provides a good foundation for you to jump into learning more JS and frontend skills.

history.content: The CS169 project does use JS but I think they change it to CS169L now.

Curious if there's any EECS courses that use javascript, other than the web design decal. 

Also- thoughts on the web design decal? As a junior applying to software engineering internships, is it a good move?
history.subject: Are there any CS courses that use javascript?
